title: Marvel Parasitic Twin Soulmate AU
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2Cb3Ro1

by BaronVonChop

A Marvel Soulmate AU where everybody in the world is born carrying their soulmate’s parasitic twin. Mild body horror, but mostly odd fluff.

Words: 1020, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

summary:
@mistressstrange said:  “Are you flirting with me?” “You finally noticed?” Dr. Strange/Clint Barton
Pairing: Stephen...
body:
@mistressstrange said: “Are you flirting with me?” “You finally noticed?” Dr. Strange/Clint Barton

Pairing: Stephen Strange/Clint Barton

Rating: Fluff

13. “Are you flirting with me?” “You finally noticed?”

“Nice aim,” Stephen said as he watched Clint send arrow after arrow flying through the air, hitting every target no matter the distance or difficulty. The archer didn’t show any signs of hearing him, instead he kept at it, brows furrowed. Stephen dismissed it as Clint being too caught up in his training to acknowledge his compliment, instead taking a seat on a nearby bench to continue watching the man train.

“Stark did a good job with the uniform,” Stephen ventured again after some time spent in silence, “it looks good on you.”

Clint continued to ignore the sorcerer’s voice, switching from using his bow to training with knives on a couple of nearby dummies.

“It’d look even better on my floor,” Stephen followed up, breath just slightly catching in his throat when the aforementioned uniform gave him a detailed picture of the blonde’s backside as he bent to slash at a dummy’s ankles. Even his Cloak seemed to snicker at the expired pick up line, but the silence was getting to him and he didn’t know whether to continue or abort mission.

It would’ve been easier if the archer at least glanced in his direction once. As it were though, Clint had yet to acknowledge Stephen’s presence in the room.

The brunet kept his silence for the remainder of Clint’s training, mind filled with thoughts of good pick-up lines or flirting techniques but also strategies to get Clint to look at him. Before long, the training session was over, and Clint headed over to a table where a towel and his water bottle waited for him. He fiddled with something out of Stephen’s sight before he uncapped the bottle and started gulping on the water, so Stephen took it as an opportunity to slip in another flirtation.

“As good as it is to watch you train, Clint, I think I could give you a better reason to get all sweaty.”

Clint nearly choked himself on the water he was drinking, immediately pulling the bottle away from his mouth and coughing. Though Stephen wasn’t happy to have caused Clint to choke –at least not like that–, he was satisfied he’d finally gotten a reaction out of the archer.

“Are you flirting with me?” Clint asked after he calmed down from the coughing fit.

“You finally noticed?”

Clint’s expression turned into confusion before his eyes widened. “Wait, you’ve been here this entire time? Talking to me?”

“Yeah,” Stephen scoffed, “thought that was obvious.”

The other man threw his head back in a bark of laughter, his face full of joy.

“Oh my- oh my god- you-“ his laughter kept interrupting him, but Stephen grew steadily more confused by the second. What was so funny?

“I didn’t have my hearing aids in,” Clint finally explained. “I don’t wear them when I train, helps to train my body to react without the presence of sound. You never know,” he shrugged.

Realization dawned on Stephen and he shook his head, a smile playing at his lips too now.

“I should have realized, I’m sorry.”

“Nah, it’s okay,” Clint reassured him, patting Stephen on the shoulder. “Now what’s that you were saying about making me sweaty?” he grinned, his touch going from a friendly pat to a sensual caress as it traveled up to Stephen’s neck.

“Wanna find out?” he breathed out, gasping when Clint’s lips attached themselves to Stephen’s neck without warning.

title: CAPTAIN MARVEL IS SO GOOD
body:
Yesterday i went to see it with my mom and OMGGGGGG!

So here’s some things that i think about the movie. Spoiler free. Here we go…:

-Carol Danvers is A BADASS! Nothing new, right? But, like, she’s so sassy, i love her personality so much. Also her relationship with Fury is really good to see.

-GOOSE. That cat is everything! When they said he stole the show i never imagined it was this way!! Mind = blown

-THE DAMN POST CREDIT SCENE.

-The message. It empowers you but it is not “”overly feminist”” as some would say. That part in the trailer when she keeps getting up when she’s on the ground is sick in the movie.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Rescue
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2SOdlLe

by Isi1dur

Without warning, a hand closed around his throat from behind, lifting 11 off the ground and turning him toward the owner of the hand. It was a Trueborn Mog; the others were Vatborn, cannon fodder, grown to die. This one would have been esteemed as royalty by his companions, had there been any more to esteem him. He looked furious, his hatred clear in his sneer and the tight grip on 11’s neck.

Spots swirled around his vision and he struggled to draw a breath. Is this it? The last Mogadorian and I fail at the very end? Cruel.

The Mog opened his mouth to say something, but before he got a word out, a hiss sounded from 11’s left and something pierced the Mog’s head, killing him instantly.

His vision darkening, 11 looked at the object in the Mog’s head as it let go of him and fell to the ground.

An arrow?

And then: nothingness.

by Isi1dur

Without warning, a hand closed around his throat from behind, lifting 11 off the ground and turning him toward the owner of the hand. It was a Trueborn Mog; the others were Vatborn, cannon fodder, grown to die. This one would have been esteemed as royalty by his companions, had there been any more to esteem him. He looked furious, his hatred clear in his sneer and the tight grip on 11’s neck.

Spots swirled around his vision and he struggled to draw a breath. Is this it? The last Mogadorian and I fail at the very end? Cruel.

The Mog opened his mouth to say something, but before he got a word out, a hiss sounded from 11’s left and something pierced the Mog’s head, killing him instantly.

His vision darkening, 11 looked at the object in the Mog’s head as it let go of him and fell to the ground.

An arrow?

And then: nothingness.
